intro: Hieracium setigeriforme, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, hairy pubescence. Its leaves are lanceolate to ovate, with serrated margins, and the flowers are yellow, arranged in a dense inflorescence. Hieracium setigeriforme is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
